Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star Topical; Using 4.8 fb⁻¹ of data taken with the CLEO II detector, the branching fraction for the Cabibbo suppressed decay D⁺ → π°ℓ⁺ν measured relative to the Cabibbo favored decay D⁺ → {bar K}°ℓ⁺ν is found to be 0.046 ± 0.014 ± 0.017. Using V{sub cs} and V{sub cd} from unitarity constraints, we determine  ₊{sup π}(0)/f₊{sup K} (0) AC03-76SF00515 Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields. edbsc Branching Ratio. Decay. Neutrinos.
